title: Understanding Applied Behavior Analysis
text: Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) is a scientific approach that involves applying interventions to improve specific behaviors. It is often used to help individuals with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) by modifying behaviors and evaluating the effectiveness of these interventions.

title: Components of ABA
text: ABA involves two main components: 1) Systematically applying interventions to modify behavior, and 2) Collecting data to evaluate the effect of each intervention on the individual's behavior.
